Fellow Citizens:
In appealing to yon for aid and a
struction of the New Orleans, Opelousas and Great Western Railroad, the Board of Directors have thought it
incumhent on them to present you some facts in relation
to this grand enterprise, to which they most respectfully
call your attention.
This Company is permanently organized under a charter to construct a railroad from Algiers to Washington,
in the Parish of St. Landry, via. Thibodaux, Berwick's
Bay, New Iberia, &c, a distance of about one hundred
and sixty miles, by which all the rich section of our
State, which is almost entirely ciit off from access to
this City during several months in the year, will be
placed within a few hours proximity, at all times and at
>U seasons.
There is no- portion of Louisiana which affords the
s*me advantages for the developement of those resources
°n which the inhabitants of this City depend for the necessary articles of food.
